Issues.Title: Translation items in messages.xlf are ordered uncertainly.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/localize ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/localize": "10.1.6" ### Description All of several results, i.e. `messages.xlf`, of running `ng extract-i18n` has differences in the order of `` and ``, in spite of no-change in html files. `--ivy false` option for `ng extract-i18n` fixes this, but ivy seems default in Angular 11, and our product compiled with ivy. So `ng extract-i18n` shows warnning like follow: ``` Ivy extraction not enabled but application is Ivy enabled. If the extraction fails, the `--ivy` flag will enable Ivy extraction. ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Run `ng extract-i18n` several times for product compiled with ivy. 2. Run `diff` with `messages.xlf` for each result of `ng extract-i18n`. ## üî• Exception or Error

Node: 12.18.4
OS: linux x64

Issues.Title: [Docs][Tutorial] unused complexity on hero deletion
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

On the last section of the Tour of Heroes tutorial, a [feature is added](https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt6#delete-a-hero) to delete an existing hero.
Considering the provided function into the `HeroService` : 

```ts
/** DELETE: delete the hero from the server */
deleteHero(hero: Hero | number): Observable<Hero> {
  const id = typeof hero === 'number' ? hero : hero.id;
  const url = `${this.heroesUrl}/${id}`;

  return this.http.delete<Hero>(url, this.httpOptions).pipe(
    tap(_ => this.log(`deleted hero id=${id}`)),
    catchError(this.handleError<Hero>('deleteHero'))
  );
}
```

It only used once into the app, into the HeroComponent : 

```ts
delete(hero: Hero): void {
    this.heroes = this.heroes.filter(h => h !== hero);
    this.heroService.deleteHero(hero).subscribe();
  }
```

As the provided argument is always an `Hero`, there is no explicit reason the parameter is of type `Hero | number` into the `HeroService`. It might lead to confusion.

As the `deleteHero()` from the `HeroService` just need the hero id, i would suggest refactoring the current code to : 


```ts
// HeroComponent
delete(hero: Hero): void {
    this.heroes = this.heroes.filter(h => h !== hero);
    this.heroService.deleteHero(hero.id).subscribe();
  }
```

```ts
// HeroService
deleteHero(id: number): Observable<Hero> {
  const url = `${this.heroesUrl}/${id}`;

  return this.http.delete<Hero>(url, this.httpOptions).pipe(
    tap(_ => this.log(`deleted hero id=${id}`)),
    catchError(this.handleError<Hero>('deleteHero'))
  );
}
```

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt6#delete-a-hero

### Reproduction Steps**
Add the deletion feature to the Tour of Heroes tutorial app

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
the `deleteHero()` function from the `HeroService expects an argument of type `Hero | number` while it never pass a number in the existing code.


### Anything else relevant?
I can open a PR if the suggestion is accepted
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Docs][Tutorial] unused complexity on hero deletion" (#41233)

Issues.Title: Hidden auxilliary routes
Issues.Body:
Hello, 

# üöÄ feature request

### Description
I think it would be nice if auxilliary routes had an option to be hidden from the browser url.

Today it is possible to hide it from the url by navigating with _skipLocationChange: true_ but the secondary outlet url appears again when navigating to subsequent routes.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like to pass some option when navigating to the auxiliary route so it would navigate silently. Like the following:
`this.router.navigate([{ outlets: { secondary: 'any' } }], { silently: true,  });`

Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hidden auxilliary routes" (#41232)

Issues.Title: @angular/pwa: Angular Service Worker (ngsw-worker.js) does not install if there's a timer active.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/pwa ### Is this a regression? I don't know. ### Description If during the initialization of the application, a setTimeout (or related) call is performed, the browser won't request ngsw-worker.js from the server (and register it as consequence) until the scheduled task executes. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/mdarefull/pwa-appinsights-tests ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.2.4
Node: 14.9.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 11.2.5
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
... service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes
Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.4
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.4
@angular/cli                    11.2.4
@schematics/angular             11.2.4
@schematics/update              0.1102.4
rxjs                            6.6.6
typescript                      4.1.5
**Anything else relevant?** 1. The easiest way to test the issue is to use http-server. I included it as a dev-dependency and added an npm script. Just do `npm run server` 2. To test it, open a new blank tab, open developer tools, and ensure the application has been cleared and no service worker is registered. You can also simply use Incognito Mode. 3. Browse to http://localhost:8080 4. Keep an eye on the network tab, the service worker will be requested and registered immediately: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22510674/111231661-663a9200-85c8-11eb-85db-683838332e16.png) 5. Go to the app.component.ts and uncomment line 12. It is an On Init statement, that creates a timeout that prints a console msg after 30 seconds. 6. Repeat steps 2-4. This time, the service worker will be requested exactly after 30 seconds. You can put whatever number in the timeout for further testing. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22510674/111231909-d2b59100-85c8-11eb-8232-168dea1c021a.png) The issue not only occurs with trivial timeouts as this one. I use NGRX and added a delay to an effect that executes when the app starts, and the result was the same. What's worst, is that any 3rd party library could use something similar and break service workers. I originally found the issue on a production application, hosted in Azure App Service. It happened if I simply instantiate and load an Azure App Insights instance. I tried to defer app insights initialization with a timeout/delay to 'give the browser time' to install the worker, and that's how I found the timer was an issue. I tested the problem with the latest version of Chrome and Edge.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular/pwa: Angular Service Worker (ngsw-worker.js) does not install if there's a timer active." (#41223)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): do not compile JavaScript sources if typings-only processing is repeated
Issues.Body:
The recently introduced typings-only mode in ngcc would incorrectly
write compiled JavaScript files if typings-only mode was requested, in
case the typings of the entry-point had already been processed in a
prior run of ngcc. The corresponding format property for which the
JavaScript files were written were not marked as processed, though, as
the typings-only mode excluded the format property itself from being
marked as processed. Consequently, subsequent runs of ngcc would not
consider the entry-point to have been processed and recompile the
JavaScript bundle once more, resulting in duplicate ngcc imports.

Fixes #41198
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ngcc): do not compile JavaScript sources if typings-only processing is repeated" (#41209)

Issues.Title: docs: Add documentation for `error NG2007: Ignore abstract classes`
Issues.Body:
Please ignore abstract classes. Currently I cannot build. The compiler throws:

> NG2007: Class is using Angular features but is not decorated. Please add an explicit Angular decorator.

```ts
export abstract class MyAbstractComponent implements OnInit, OnDestroy {}
```

You can detect it by the keyword `abstract`. 
Is there a workaround? A config to ignore this error?
How does Angular detect it? By the extended Interfaces or the suffix "Component"?

Angular `11.2.5`

Update: I changed the name to `MyComponentAbstract`. Not working...
My current workaround is: 

```ts
@Component({ template: '' })
export abstract class MyAbstractComponent implements OnInit, OnDestroy {}
```

(dummy decorator)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: Add documentation for `error NG2007: Ignore abstract classes`" (#41229)

Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description Into the part 5 of the tutorial, we add a routerlink to navigate to the heroes list with the [Add a navigation link section](https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5#add-a-navigation-link-routerlink). After adding it, there are these indications : ``` The browser refreshes and displays the application title and heroes link, but not the heroes list. Click the link. The address bar updates to /heroes and the list of heroes appears. ``` However, as the previous section asks to navigate manually to `/heroes` by adding it into the browser's address bar, when the link is added, the url is still `localhost:4200/heroes`. So the heroes list is already visible and clicking on the link won't affect the app. It applies also to the [add a default route section](https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5#add-a-default-route) : ``` After the browser refreshes, the router loads the DashboardComponent and the browser address bar shows the /dashboard URL. ``` The url is still `localhost:4200/heroes` at this point : by refreshing the browser, it won't navigate to `localhost:4200/dashboard`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5#add-a-navigation-link-routerlink ### Reproduction Steps** Follow the previous step : `Append /heroes to the URL in the browser address bar. You should see the familiar heroes master/detail view.` Follow the current step ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** In order to test out the navigation link, it should be asked to navigate back to `localhost:4200` firstly to simulate an initial user experience onto the app. ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?

Issues.Title: TypeScript not happy with some example code in tutorial (Tour of Heros) part 5 (navigation)
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

In tutorial Tour of Heros part 5 (add navigation), some example codes are failing typescript checks. 
Minor issues, but still better to be fixed some time.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5


## üì∑Screenshot

### cleaned up version of code
In src/app/heroes/heroes.component.ts (cleaned up):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17248038/111064965-3e392900-850b-11eb-8726-ea77fa946906.png)
my quick fix: `heroes: Hero[] = [];` 

### getHero function in HeroService
https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt5#add-heroservicegethero
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17248038/111065018-9839ee80-850b-11eb-9e84-0c680da57b03.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17248038/111065048-bc95cb00-850b-11eb-82e1-12f4ec064cdf.png)
suggestion: add a fallback when no id matches. 
```
getHero(id: number): Observable<Hero> {
    this.messageService.add(`HeroService: fetched hero id=${id}`);
    let result = HEROES.find(hero => hero.id === id);
    return of(!!result ? result: {id: id, name: "No result"});
  }
```

Issues.Title: Consider supporting `forwardRef` in `providedIn` fields of @Injectable decorators
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package

@angular/core

### Description

`@Injectable` decorators support passing an NgModule reference as a value of the `providedIn` field, for ex:

```
@Injectable({ providedIn: MyModule })
class MyProvider {}
```

This makes the provider tree-shakable (as this provider is not referenced directly inside an NgModule def).

Currently, there is no `forwardRef` support in the `providedIn` field of the `@Injectable` decorator, which forces the limitation of defining an NgModule before an Injectable class. In some cases this is very inconvenient, see PR #41126.

### Describe the solution you'd like

We should consider adding `forwardRef` support to the `providedIn` property values, so the example above may look like this:

```
@Injectable({ providedIn: forwardRef(() => MyModule) })
class MyProvider {}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Consider supporting `forwardRef` in `providedIn` fields of @Injectable decorators" (#41205)

Issues.Title: test(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid crashing during test failure in utility function
Issues.Body: Previously, if a browser build failed using the `browserBuild` test utility function, the test utility would try to access properties that did not exist and would crash. This increased the complexity to debug failing tests. With the new behavior, the `browserBuild` test utility will return with an empty `files` object and the failed builder result.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid crashing during test failure in utility function" (#20296)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): remove Webpack 5 deprecation warning in resource loader
Issues.Body: This change adds support for using the Webpack `processAssets` hook to handle the resource loader child compilation's assets. This new hook is the recommended way to process assets in Webpack 5+.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): remove Webpack 5 deprecation warning in resource loader" (#20295)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): expose legacy-migrate message format
Issues.Body:
We recently added a new message format called `legacy-extract` that is used to migrate between legacy and canonical message IDs (see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/41026).

These changes expose the new format in `extract-i18n`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): expose legacy-migrate message format" (#20294)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support writing large Webpack stat output
Issues.Body:
When using the `statsJson` browser builder option, the resulting JSON data is now streamed into a file instead of written in one large block.  This mitigates crashes due to the generated string exceeded the Node.js limit.

Fixes #20271
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support writing large Webpack stat output" (#20292)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable `showCircularDependencies` by default
Issues.Body:
Change the default of this flag to disabled by default as this is a caused of rebuild performance degradation for large projects.

BREAKING CHANGE

The server and browser builder `showCircularDependencies` option default value has been changed from `true` to `false`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable `showCircularDependencies` by default" (#20278)

Closes #20105, closes #18465, closes #17382 and closes #13732

Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |

| [webpack](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) | [`4.44.2` -> `5.26.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/webpack/4.44.2/5.26.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.26.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.26.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.26.0/compatibility-slim/4.44.2)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.26.0/confidence-slim/4.44.2)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack</summary>

### [`v5.26.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.26.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.25.1...v5.26.0)

### Features

-   handle cache version automatically for DefinePlugin
    -   Values no longer need to be defined as build dependencies
-   add more options for `DefinePlugin.runtimeValue` (file/context/missing/buildDependencies, version)

### Bugfixes

-   fix a memory leak which happens in watch mode with caching when modules are removed from the compilation
-   fix usage of some arrow functions when es5 target is selected
-   chunk loading in workers now uses publicPath instead of relative paths
    -   fixes a problem when worker file is in a child directory

### [`v5.25.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.25.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.25.0...v5.25.1)

##### Bugfixes

-   fix startup logic when non-js chunks are in the entrypoint
-   remove `type: "module"` for Workers when generating classic scripts

### [`v5.25.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.25.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.4...v5.25.0)

### Features

-   Refactor the startup logic to improve library support
-   add `__webpack_runtime_id__` to access the current runtime id
-   improve error handling for HMR
    -   add second argument to self accept error handler to pass new module and module id
    -   add error handler argument to dependency accept, passing error and module ids
-   add `output.strictModuleErrorHandling` to opt into stricter evaluation error handling semantics according to ESM spec
    -   used by default when HMR is enabled
-   when ignoring a module used by `new URL()` this will result in an url to a empty file (`"data:,"`)
-   add `module.generator.asset.emit` option to disable creating assets from asset modules (e. g. for SSR)

### Bugfixes

-   fix problem when library options apply to a non-runtime chunk
-   fix crash in `splitChunks.maxSize` where negative indicies are accessed
-   fix sub-optimal splitting of `splitChunks.maxSize` in some cases when multiple size types are involved
-   fix a memory leak in AssetGenerator
-   fix usage of runtime globals in SharedPlugin to support HMR updates

### Deprecations

-   deprecate `output.strictModuleExceptionHandling` (this is the CommonJS way of handling errors, and the name is weird)

### [`v5.24.4`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.4)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.3...v5.24.4)

### Bugfixes

-   fix overridding built-in externals via `externals`
-   fix handling UNC paths as windows paths
-   Improve error when passing an empty array as library name
-   avoid adding the package.json from compilation context as build dependency
-   fix expansion of `"..."` in array configuration options when it's not at the start

### [`v5.24.3`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.3)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.2...v5.24.3)

### Bugfixes

-   fix contenthash when a file is emitted twice with different filenames but that same contenthash

### [`v5.24.2`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.1...v5.24.2)

##### Bugfixes

-   fix invalid syntax generated for destructuring with default values
-   fix some incorrect properties accesses in watch
    -   `modifiedFiles` and `removedFiles` were undefined
-   fix some edge cases with MultiCompiler

### [`v5.24.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.0...v5.24.1)

##### Performance

-   improve performance of finding modules to concatenate
-   improve performance of getting incoming modules from connections
-   make sure that all serialized modules restore correctly
-   avoid storing ConcatenatedModule, since that's not needed

##### Developer Experience

-   fix typo in deprecation message

### [`v5.24.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.23.0...v5.24.0)

### Bugfixes

-   fix name conflict when using destructing with default arguments in concatenated modules
-   fix tracking of reexports in concatenated modules when using multiple `export *` that point to the same export
-   debug logging is now included even if logging is not
-   fix name of ModuleConcatenationPlugin logger
-   fix `experiments.lazyCompilation: true`. It now has an effect.

### Developer Experience

-   expose `Watching` type

### Contribution

-   fix husky setup

### Performance

-   improve performance of module concatenation

### [`v5.23.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.23.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.22.0...v5.23.0)

### Features

-   add `parserOptions.url: "relative"` option
    -   Allows to generate relative URLs from `new URL` (e. g. for SSG/SSR)

### Bugfixes

-   fixes for electron target
    -   electron has importScripts in worker
    -   only choose a chunkLoading which fits to the chunkFormat
    -   prefer fetch wasm loading over node wasm loading
-   fix regression when combining library + runtimeChunk + node target

### Developer Experience

-   export MultiStats type

### [`v5.22.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.22.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.21.2...v5.22.0)

### Features

-   generate shorter output code for JSON data by using a `'...'` string instead of `"..."` (only affects output side when not minimized)
-   the `dependencies` configuration option now works for watch builds too
    -   It will build compilation when any of `dependencies` has changed
    -   It will wait for compiling until all of `dependencies` have finished
-   add `parallelism` config option on the array of configurations to limit the compilers that are running in parallel

### Developer Experience

-   add hints (`Did you mean ...`) to resolve errors when
    -   resolving fails due to `enforceExtension`
    -   relative request is missing leading `./`
-   when all modules of an entrypoint fail resolving and another entrypoints `depend(s)On` it, webpack no longer crashes with a weird error
-   add hint to stats how to get details about errors/warnings in child compilations
-   improve error message for lazyCompilation when using IE11

### Bugfixes

-   async entries e.g. for Workers are now implicitly flagged as "having side effects" even if they are affects by `"sideEffects": false`
    -   in future we might add a warning for this
-   avoid crash when using `this.loadModule` (loader) and the loaded module has errors
-   refactor libraries to inline exporting code into runtime to allow using with `output.iife: false`
-   fix invalid code when using `define` for local modules and arrow functions are supported
-   fix missing runtime requirement for system.js context
-   fix parsing of `define` function, which missed declarations before
-   avoid unnecessary calls to loaders when serializer are already registered
-   fix inner graph analysis for exports when `export { x }` is before pure declaration `const x = /*#__PURE__*/ f()`
-   fix hashing order of runtime chunks when there are async entries involved

### Contribution

-   CI run tests on node.js 15 too
-   CI run tests on github actions too

### Experiments

-   improvements on experimental `output.library: { type: "module" }` (`experiments.outputModule: true`)
    -   it can generate `export { ... }` now, but that can't handle live-bindings yet

</details>

Issues.Title: Bundling a index.cshtml that's containing generics doesn't work
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [x] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.0.7 ### Description Upgrading from v9 to v11 changed the way webpack transplies HTML. The issue we're having is by changing the `index.html` target to a `index.cshtml` containing generics, the outputted bundled `index.cshtml` will have changed the generic casing to all lowercase (instead of preserving PascalCase). It seems like it's parsing open and close <> as an HTML tag, and runs some lower casing on it? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I've made a repo containing the issue: https://github.com/EmilNordling/angular-razor-bug Installing node modules and running the build script is sufficient. ## üî• Exception or Error ```razor // Expects that this should be preserved @inject Microsoft.Extensions.Options.IOptions myValue // Rather than getting outputted as: @inject Microsoft.Extensions.Options.IOptions myValue ``` ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/core): option to remove trailing new line in template
Issues.Body:
This commits add an option to the template parser to remove new line
characters that immediately follow an evaluation expression.

For example, currently
```
<% if (expr) { %>
foo
<% } %>
```
would generate
```
     <-- new line
foo
     <-- new line
```
With this change the output will be
```
foo
```

This option is backwards compatible since it is disabled by default.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/core): option to remove trailing new line in template" (#20277)

Issues.Title: Add support for SharedWorker in ng-cli
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/cli

### Description
ng generate can currently handle web-workers and service-workers, but not shared-workers. It would be very helpful if shared workers could be handled similarly.

Right now there's very little documentation about how to setup shared workers with angular, unlike web workers where I can simply call `ng generate web-worker` and start filling in my code.

### Describe the solution you'd like
There should be an `ng generate shared-worker` command that works similar to the commands for web and service workers.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
This [medium article](https://medium.com/@nikita.s.barsukov/dedicated-and-shared-web-workers-in-angular-c3df473882f6) and [these](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64495077/how-to-use-sharedworker-in-angular/64495078#64495078) [two](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46159496/how-to-configure-angular-cli-generated-project-to-include-a-sharedworker) Stack Overflow questions both have different solutions to make this work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add support for SharedWorker in ng-cli" (#20279)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove Webpack Stats.toJson usage in analytics plugin
Issues.Body: Webpack's `Stats.toJson` function is an expensive operation and is recommended to be avoided where possible. In the case of the analytics plugin, the chunks and assets can be accessed directly from the Webpack compilation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove Webpack Stats.toJson usage in analytics plugin" (#20267)

Issues.Title: Angular is unable to handle large stats.json file
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Description Angular fails to generate `stats.json` file for big projects with the following error: ``` Generating browser application bundles (phase: chunk asset optimization)...An unhandled exception occurred: Invalid string length ``` Looks like it's been solved for `webpack-cli` https://github.com/webpack/webpack-cli/pull/2190/files however Angular is using it's own way of handling stats: ``` compiler.hooks.emit.tap('angular-cli-stats', compilation => { const data = JSON.stringify(compilation.getStats().toJson('verbose'), undefined, 2); compilation.assets['stats.json'] = new webpack_sources_1.RawSource(data); }); ``` Also noticed the size of `stats.json` increased multiple times after using webpack 5. ## üî• Exception or Error 

Generating browser application bundles (phase: chunk asset optimization)...An unhandled exception occurred: Invalid string length
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 




     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 11.2.3
Node: 14.15.5
OS: linux x64

Angular: 11.2.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router
... service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1102.3
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.3
@angular/cdk                    9.2.4
@angular/cli                    11.2.3

@angular/material               9.2.4

@nguniversal/express-engine     11.2.1
@schematics/angular             11.2.3

typescript                      4.1.5
**Anything else relevant?** Tried to use `--stats-json` webpack flag instead of angular's `"statsJson": true` and changing log level from `verbose` to something else but when using `verbose` stats.json has 24k lines, when using `info` it has 91k line. Despite the conditions having less details included for `info` type: ``` case "none": acceptedTypes = new Set([]); break; case "error": acceptedTypes = new Set([LogType.error]); break; case "warn": acceptedTypes = new Set([LogType.error, LogType.warn]); break; case "info": acceptedTypes = new Set([LogType.error, LogType.warn, LogType.info]); break; case true: case "log": acceptedTypes = new Set([ LogType.error, LogType.warn, LogType.info, LogType.log, LogType.group, LogType.groupEnd, LogType.groupCollapsed, LogType.clear ]); break; case "verbose": acceptedTypes = new Set([ LogType.error, LogType.warn, LogType.info, LogType.log, LogType.group, LogType.groupEnd, LogType.groupCollapsed, LogType.profile, LogType.profileEnd, LogType.time, LogType.status, LogType.clear ]); collapsedGroups = true; break; ``` Maybe because of the `collapsedGroups = true`. Anyway changing type is not a proper solution as it's just delaying the problem.

Issues.Title: build: update webpack to version 5.25.1
Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|

| [webpack](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) | [`^4.6.0` -> `^5.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/webpack/4.46.0/5.25.1) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/compatibility-slim/4.46.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/confidence-slim/4.46.0)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |
| [webpack](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) | [`4.44.2` -> `5.25.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/webpack/4.44.2/5.25.1) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/compatibility-slim/4.44.2)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/webpack/5.25.1/confidence-slim/4.44.2)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack</summary>

### [`v5.25.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.25.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.25.0...v5.25.1)

### Bugfixes

-   fix startup logic when non-js chunks are in the entrypoint
-   remove `type: "module"` for Workers when generating classic scripts

### [`v5.25.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.25.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.4...v5.25.0)

### Features

-   Refactor the startup logic to improve library support
-   add `__webpack_runtime_id__` to access the current runtime id
-   improve error handling for HMR
    -   add second argument to self accept error handler to pass new module and module id
    -   add error handler argument to dependency accept, passing error and module ids
-   add `output.strictModuleErrorHandling` to opt into stricter evaluation error handling semantics according to ESM spec
    -   used by default when HMR is enabled
-   when ignoring a module used by `new URL()` this will result in an url to a empty file (`"data:,"`)
-   add `module.generator.asset.emit` option to disable creating assets from asset modules (e. g. for SSR)

### Bugfixes

-   fix problem when library options apply to a non-runtime chunk
-   fix crash in `splitChunks.maxSize` where negative indicies are accessed
-   fix sub-optimal splitting of `splitChunks.maxSize` in some cases when multiple size types are involved
-   fix a memory leak in AssetGenerator
-   fix usage of runtime globals in SharedPlugin to support HMR updates

### Deprecations

-   deprecate `output.strictModuleExceptionHandling` (this is the CommonJS way of handling errors, and the name is weird)

### [`v5.24.4`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.4)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.3...v5.24.4)

### Bugfixes

-   fix overridding built-in externals via `externals`
-   fix handling UNC paths as windows paths
-   Improve error when passing an empty array as library name
-   avoid adding the package.json from compilation context as build dependency
-   fix expansion of `"..."` in array configuration options when it's not at the start

### [`v5.24.3`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.3)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.2...v5.24.3)

### Bugfixes

-   fix contenthash when a file is emitted twice with different filenames but that same contenthash

### [`v5.24.2`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.1...v5.24.2)

### Bugfixes

-   fix invalid syntax generated for destructuring with default values
-   fix some incorrect properties accesses in watch
    -   `modifiedFiles` and `removedFiles` were undefined
-   fix some edge cases with MultiCompiler

### [`v5.24.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.1)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.24.0...v5.24.1)

### Performance

-   improve performance of finding modules to concatenate
-   improve performance of getting incoming modules from connections
-   make sure that all serialized modules restore correctly
-   avoid storing ConcatenatedModule, since that's not needed

### Developer Experience

-   fix typo in deprecation message

### [`v5.24.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.24.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.23.0...v5.24.0)

### Bugfixes

-   fix name conflict when using destructing with default arguments in concatenated modules
-   fix tracking of reexports in concatenated modules when using multiple `export *` that point to the same export
-   debug logging is now included even if logging is not
-   fix name of ModuleConcatenationPlugin logger
-   fix `experiments.lazyCompilation: true`. It now has an effect.

### Developer Experience

-   expose `Watching` type

### Contribution

-   fix husky setup

### Performance

-   improve performance of module concatenation

### [`v5.23.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.23.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.22.0...v5.23.0)

### Features

-   add `parserOptions.url: "relative"` option
    -   Allows to generate relative URLs from `new URL` (e. g. for SSG/SSR)

### Bugfixes

-   fixes for electron target
    -   electron has importScripts in worker
    -   only choose a chunkLoading which fits to the chunkFormat
    -   prefer fetch wasm loading over node wasm loading
-   fix regression when combining library + runtimeChunk + node target

### Developer Experience

-   export MultiStats type

### [`v5.22.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.22.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.21.2...v5.22.0)

### Features

-   generate shorter output code for JSON data by using a `'...'` string instead of `"..."` (only affects output side when not minimized)
-   the `dependencies` configuration option now works for watch builds too
    -   It will build compilation when any of `dependencies` has changed
    -   It will wait for compiling until all of `dependencies` have finished
-   add `parallelism` config option on the array of configurations to limit the compilers that are running in parallel

### Developer Experience

-   add hints (`Did you mean ...`) to resolve errors when
    -   resolving fails due to `enforceExtension`
    -   relative request is missing leading `./`
-   when all modules of an entrypoint fail resolving and another entrypoints `depend(s)On` it, webpack no longer crashes with a weird error
-   add hint to stats how to get details about errors/warnings in child compilations
-   improve error message for lazyCompilation when using IE11

### Bugfixes

-   async entries e.g. for Workers are now implicitly flagged as "having side effects" even if they are affects by `"sideEffects": false`
    -   in future we might add a warning for this
-   avoid crash when using `this.loadModule` (loader) and the loaded module has errors
-   refactor libraries to inline exporting code into runtime to allow using with `output.iife: false`
-   fix invalid code when using `define` for local modules and arrow functions are supported
-   fix missing runtime requirement for system.js context
-   fix parsing of `define` function, which missed declarations before
-   avoid unnecessary calls to loaders when serializer are already registered
-   fix inner graph analysis for exports when `export { x }` is before pure declaration `const x = /*#__PURE__*/ f()`
-   fix hashing order of runtime chunks when there are async entries involved

### Contribution

-   CI run tests on node.js 15 too
-   CI run tests on github actions too

### Experiments

-   improvements on experimental `output.library: { type: "module" }` (`experiments.outputModule: true`)
    -   it can generate `export { ... }` now, but that can't handle live-bindings yet

</details>

Issues.Title: bug(ListKeyManager): active item reference remains although the child component is already deleted
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/active-item-reference?file=src/app/app.component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Click 'Fill List'
2.  Click 'Clear List'
 

#### Expected Behavior

It should display the message 'ActiveItem: null', because the `activeItem` should be null, when there are no items.


#### Actual Behavior

It displays the message 'ActiveItem: "0"'.   
It has no items, but the `activeItem` still contains a reference of a deleted node.


#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.4
- CDK/Material: 11.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(ListKeyManager): active item reference remains although the child component is already deleted" (#22249)

Issues.Title: build: bump yaml from 1.10.0 to 1.10.2
Issues.Body:
Bumps [yaml](https://github.com/eemeli/yaml) from 1.10.0 to 1.10.2.
Release notes

Sourced from yaml's releases.

v1.10.2

  • Allow for unindented comment after node props (prettier/prettier#10510)

v1.10.1

This release backports the following non-breaking fixes made during the work on yaml@2 on top of yaml@1.10.0:

  • Support for __proto__ as mapping key & anchor identifier (#192)
  • Fix broken TS type for BigInt toggle
  • Dump long keys properly (#195)
  • When folding highly indented lines, require at least minContentWidth chars on the first line (#196)
  • Fix YAML.stringify() for certain null values (#197)
  • Do not break escaped chars with escaped newlines (#237, awslabs/cdk8s8)
  • Set type: "module" within browser/dist/ (#208)
  • Use CommonJS for the browser endpoints yaml/types & yaml/util (#208)
  • Always stringify non-Node object keys using explicit notation (#218)
  • Specify node type of Document.Parsed.contents (#221)

Issues.Title: CDK VirtualScroll: Event when user stops scrolling in virtual scroll
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

Im having a table with thousands of records to be displayed on the single page. So, Im using virtual scroll to display the data thereby I could minimize DOM manipulation.

There, I would like to apply the css at run time. Once the user stops the scrolling on my virtual scroll table, I need to apply the css to my table.


#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I have searched for any events in cdk. I have found the scolled event in scrolldispatcher but i couldnt able to find the event while user stops the scrolling. Please help me on this.

 ```
this.scrollDispatcher.scrolled()
      .subscribe(event => {
        console.log('scrolled');
      });
```



Any help would be greatly appreciated!! Thanks in advance

  
#### Environment

- Angular: 8 
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CDK VirtualScroll: Event when user stops scrolling in virtual scroll" (#22248)

Issues.Body:
Bumps [firebase-tools](https://github.com/firebase/firebase-tools) from 9.5.0 to 9.6.1.
Release notes

Sourced from firebase-tools's releases.

v9.6.1

  • Adds hosting:sites:<create|get|list|delete> commands to allow managing Hosting Sites.
  • Fixes extra logging and race conditions when disabling emulated background functions.

v9.6.0

  • Fixes issue where proxied requests to dynamic content through the Hosting emulator would return unexpected location headers. (#3097)
  • Fixes issue where optional extension parameters could not be omitted. (#3126)
  • Fixes issues with initializing Remote Config (#3137)
  • Deploying a function with a retry policy will no longer prompt if the function already had a retry policy (firebase-functions#798)
  • Fixes issue where the Firebase Hosting emulator would fail to start with --only filters using targets (#2820).
  • Fixes issue where database:remove fails for large nodes (#3186, #3193).
